be.ac.ulb.infof307.g09.controller.shapeDTO

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.ac.ulb.infof307.g09.controller.shapeDTO.ShapeDTO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LabelizableShape, Path

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Shape is the representation of a line of tikz code, eg : \draw[thick,rounded corners=8pt] (0,0) -- (0,2) -- (1,3.25) -- (2,2) -- (2,0) -- (0,2) -- (2,2) -- (0,0) -- (2,0); In order to avoid confusion with an actual line (the shapeDTO line, who is called a path in tikz, still following ?) , it's called a shapeDTO here.

    Since it's an abstract class it's only intended to extend actual shapeDTO class, like Path.java, that should be used to represent the code line above.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Shape

        public Shape(boolean draw,
             boolean fill,
             java.lang.String shapeThicknessKey,
             int id)
        Parameters:
        draw - Is the shapeDTO have a outer line, can be combined with fill.
        fill - Is the shapeDTO filled with a color, can be combined with draw.
        shapeThicknessKey - Thickness starting value.

      • Shape

        public Shape(boolean draw,
             boolean fill,
             Color drawColor,
             Color fillColor,
             java.lang.String shapeThicknessKey,
             int id)
      throws FatalException
        Parameters:
        draw - Is the shapeDTO have a outer line, can be combined with fill.
        fill - Is the shapeDTO filled with a color, can be combined with draw.
        fillColor - Color to fill the shapeDTO with, color list in Color enum.
        drawColor - Outer line color, color list in Color enum.
        shapeThicknessKey - Thickness starting value.
        Throws:
        FatalException
